definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: The thieves agreed to divvy up with the spoils .
sentences.chinese: 盜賊們同意把贓物瓜分掉。

sentences.english: Because of good land has been strong in the pre-developer "carve up" the.
sentences.chinese: 由於良好的土地已被強大的前開發商“瓜分”了。

sentences.english: The more affordable applications typically dominate the top of the most-downloaded list.
sentences.chinese: 相對便宜的應用瓜分了下載量排行榜。

sentences.english: He reportedly divvied up key spheres of interest, such as oil, among his 6 sons.
sentences.chinese: 據稱，他的6個兒子瓜分了石油等國家命脈產業。

sentences.english: The super powersattempt to redivide the world failed.
sentences.chinese: 列強企圖重新瓜分世界的計劃破滅了。

sentences.english: The service has been credited (or blamed, depending on your point of view) with taking the classified ad market away from established newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 這項服務被認爲瓜分了報刊的分類廣告業務。

sentences.english: It looks like a treasure trove ripe for plundering.
sentences.chinese: 這看上去就像一筆正待瓜分的無主寶藏。

sentences.english: How to keep government from running up the prices of the things you buy and reducing the wages you earn.
sentences.chinese: 如何防止政府哄擡物價，如何防止它瓜分你的工資。

sentences.english: They divvied up the winnings between them.
Africa was often parceled out among the European Powers.
sentences.chinese: 非洲曾一度被歐洲列強所瓜分。

sentences.english: Do Hirelings and Minions steal your experience?
sentences.chinese: 傭兵和你的手下會瓜分你的經驗值嗎？

sentences.english: Africa was once parcelled out among the European powers.
sentences.chinese: 非洲一度爲歐洲列強所瓜分。

definition: to fight over/to contest/to vie over
to obtain by an effort/to strive to get sth
to occupy by force/to seize/to dominate
lit. you fight, I snatch (idiom); to compete fiercely offering no quarter/fierce rivalry/tug-of-war
